newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - Latam ADRs off, SAP hit in NY trade.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - Latam ADRs off, SAP hit in NY trade.

text.p: Latin American shares were off and German software company SAP AG plunged in New York trade on Tuesday, traders said.

Lucia Skwarek, head of Latin American equities trading for UBS, said American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) for Latin companies were hit by a combination of profit-taking in stock and fixed-income markets and a sagging New York Stock Exchange.
"They are all down ... only Venezuela is up," she said, adding that Argentine shares were weighed by political uncertainty brought on by allegations of official corruption.
Brazil's state telecommunications company Telebras was off 2-1/4 to 77-7/8. Telecom Argentina SA fell 5/8 to 36-5/8 and Telefonos de Mexico SA was off 1/2 to 30-3/4.

Among European shares, Britain's Cable & Wireless Plc was among percentage leaders, rising 1-3/8, or 6.63 percent, to 22-1/8. The company merged its British operations on Tuesday with those of NYNEX Corp and of BCE Inc's Bell Canada International.
Shares in German business software company SAP fell about 20 percent, hit by disappointing sales, traders said.
They said the stock, which trades in the "pink sheets" of the National Quotation Bureau, was at about 220 marks after closing in Frankfurt at 271.50.
One hundred and eight ADRs among a selected 441 had advanced and 195 had fallen by late afternoon. Volume was about 52 million shares.
